page.title: 06EDUCATION
page.content: SOMERSHAM CP SCHOOL WAS CONSTRUCTED IN 1964,REPLACING OLDER SCHOOL BUILDINGS (DATED 1782) SITUATED NEXT TO THE PARISH CHURCH.THE SCHOOL SITUATED IN EXTENSIVE GROUNDS,CATERS FOR APPROX 370 CHILDREN,AGED 5 TO 11 IN 12 CLASSES, 6 EACH OF INFANT AND JUNIOR AGE.OF INTEREST IS THAT THE SCHOOL SITS ASTRIDE THE GREENWICH MERIDIAN LINE AND RECENTLY TOOK PART IN THE GREENWICH MERIDIAN CENTENARY CELEBRATIONS, AND HAS THE LINE PAINTED ONTO THE SCHOOL BUILDINGS. TWO PLAYGROUPS, ONE USING THE SCOUT HUT ON THE VILLAGE PLAYING FIELD AND THE OTHER IN A MOBILE CLASSROOM AT THE PRIMARY SCHOOL CATER FOR PRE-SCHOOL CHILDREN. AFTER PRIMARY SCHOOL, THE CHILDREN TRANSFER TO SECONDARY SCHOOLS IN RAMSEY. THE CHILDREN ARE TAKEN DAILY BY BUS TO AND FROM THE SCHOOLS.
